bakery.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 2 cups semisweet and/or milk chocolate chips
bakery.instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Mix together flour and baking soda. Cream together butter and sugars. Add in salt, vanilla, and eggs. Gradually add flour mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough onto baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Allow to cool.

bakery.name: Blueberry Muffins
bakery.instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add in milk, egg, and oil. Stir until just combined. Fold in blueberries. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Allow to cool.

bakery.name: Banana Bread
bakery.instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Mix together flour, baking soda, and salt. Cream together butter and brown sugar. Stir in eggs and mashed bananas. Gradually add flour mixture. Pour batter into prepared loaf pan. Bake for 60-65 minutes. Allow to cool.

bakery.name: Pancakes
bakery.instructions: Mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a separate bowl, mix together buttermilk, milk, egg, and melted butter. Gradually add flour mixture. Heat a lightly oiled griddle over medium-high heat. Pour batter onto griddle. Cook until bubbles form and edges are dry. Flip and cook until browned.

bakery.name: Apple Pie
ingredients: 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie
8 Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored and sliced
bakery.instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Melt butter in a saucepan. Stir in flour, water, white sugar, and brown sugar. Bring to a boil. Reduce temperature and let simmer. Fill pie crust with apples. Cover with a lattice work crust. Pour sugar and butter liquid over the crust. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce the temperature to 350°F (175°C) and continue baking for 35-45 minutes.
